column4: Hi everyone. I'm having a hell of a time (on ubuntu) with wireless networking right now. Wicd freezes all of the time, network-manager just doesn't work period, and iwconfig can get it working most of the way, although I still can't ping my residential gateway or access the greater internet. Does anyone know what I can do?
Afaik, grub2 will automatically generate its boot list once you install/remove a kernel.
not in my experience, but it might... i always run it after removign old kernels.. but you may be right
